availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
The State of Kentucky
County of Franklin
City of Frankfort } Sct.

I, Ben F. Pumphrey having been appointed and Commissioned by His Excellency Thos E. Bramlette Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, a Commissioner of Deeds (in the District of Columbia) for the State of Kentucky, for the term of four years from 13th day of November AD 1865 -- do swear that I will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of my Station as such Commissioner. So help me God.

Sworn to by the said Ben F, Pumphrey before me, and by him subscribed in my presence, at Frankfort this 23d day of November 1865, as witness my hand, and Notorial seal affixed on the day and date aforesaid.
Chas Haydon
Notary Public
Franklin Co Ky

Comr of Deeds
Oath of Ben F. Pumphrey
filed 23d Nov/65
